channel.title: Alien's Slackware packages
channel.description: Eric Hameleers (alien's) Slackware package repository. The package directories include the SlackBuild script and sources.

item.title: Thu, 19 Dec 2013 10:46:28 GMT
item.description:
libreoffice: updated to 4.1.4 (compiled on Slackware 14.0, works fine on
  14.1 and -current).  These packages will not work on Slackware 13.37;
  use my libreoffice-3.6.7 instead.

item.title: Mon, 16 Dec 2013 00:11:55 GMT
item.description:
pipelight: updated to 0.2.3 (depends on OpenAL, cabextract, wine-pipelight)
wine-pipelight: updated to 1.7.8 (depends on OpenAL and on slackware64,
  you need full multilib including OpenAL-compat32)

item.title: Sat, 14 Dec 2013 12:04:19 GMT
item.description:
vlc: recompiled (Slackware 14.1).  I fixed the RTMP playbak which apparently
  had been broken a long time. Also I repaired the accidentally introduced
  regression that vlc would no longer play videos if libvdpau was not
  installed.

item.title: Fri, 13 Dec 2013 11:17:17 GMT
item.description:
calibre: updated to 1.15.0. Calibre's feature set has been extended with an
  integrated ebook editor, supported formats are EPUB and AZW3.
  For the (unchanged) dependency list, see the 'Fri Aug 23 14:53:15 UTC 2013'
  entry in the ChangeLog.txt.
vlc: I re-uploaded the '1alien' builds of vlc-2.1.2 for people who do not have
  libvdpau installed. Accidentally I introduced an external dependency on
  libvdpau when I added VDPAU support. I will try to get this fixed in the
  next package release, there should be zero external dependencies.

item.title: Thu, 12 Dec 2013 09:24:48 GMT
item.description:
libva: updated to 1.2.1
libva-vdpau-driver: updated to 0.7.4.  This package was renamed from
  'vdpau-video' when the VA-API libraries got new maintainers.
  You need this to use GPU-assisted video hardware decoding in a VA-API
  enabled application and using Nvidia's binary drivers
  (depends on the libvdpau and libva packages).
libva-intel-driver: added v1.2.1. This is the VA-API backend for Intel G45
  chipsets and Intel HD Graphics for Intel Core CPU's. Depends on libva.
libvdpau: updated to 0.7.
vlc: rebuilt the 2.1.2 packages.
  Enabled the VDPAU driver which solves jerky playback and crashes on machines
  with a binary Nvidia driver when GPU-assisted hardware decoding is enabled.
  You need to have libvdpau installed to use this feature.

item.title: Tue, 10 Dec 2013 21:07:30 GMT
item.description:
flashplayer-plugin: updated to 11.2.202.332.
  Verify that you are running the latest version on:
  http://www.adobe.com/software/flash/about/

item.title: Tue, 10 Dec 2013 18:08:08 GMT
item.description:
vlc: updated to 2.1.2.
  Enabled the 10-bit decoder in x624 (aka 'Hi10P' for Anime fans).
  Updates to the internal libraries for bluray, dvdnav, dvdread, ffmpeg,
  fribidi, live555, opus, speex, and x264,
  Usual caveat: versions that can not only DEcode but also ENcode mp3 and aac
  audio, and can play encrypted DVD's without the need for a separate
  libdvdcss package, can be found in my alternative repository where I keep
  the packages containing code that might violate stupid US software patents:
  http://taper.alienbase.nl/mirrors/people/alien/restricted_slackbuilds/vlc/

item.title: Mon, 9 Dec 2013 18:51:52 GMT
item.description:
mirall: updated to 1.4.2 - desktop syncing client for ownCloud (depends on
  ocsync).
  Be sure to check http://owncloud.org/ this wednesday, when the awesome
  release 6 is unveiled. It includes 'ownCloud Documents', collaborative
  editing of rich-text documents.
ocsync: updated to v0.90.4 - owncloud bidirectional sync library (depends on
  iniparser).

item.title: Sun, 8 Dec 2013 13:00:16 GMT
item.description:
tigervnc: updated to 1.3.0.
  It seems that with this version, and a series of patches, the new vncviewer
  with the FLTK based graphical interface has finally become equivalent
  in functionality compared to the old 1.1.0 version.
  If you just want to *run* my package, no other dependencies are needed; it
  has the libjpeg-turbo and fltk code statically compiled-in.
  In order to build this from source, you need to have a Java JDK installed or
  else the Java viewer will not be compiled.

item.title: Fri, 6 Dec 2013 16:27:43 GMT
item.description:
chromium: updated to 31.0.1650.63
chromium-pdf-plugin: updated to 31.0.1650.63
chromium-pepperflash-plugin: updated to 11.9.900.170

item.title: Fri, 6 Dec 2013 08:35:04 GMT
item.description:
calibre: updated to 1.14.0.
  For the (unchanged) dependency list, see the 'Fri Aug 23 14:53:15 UTC 2013'
  entry in the ChangeLog.txt.

item.title: Sat, 30 Nov 2013 19:08:09 GMT
item.description:
recordmydesktop:  applied a patch to the 0.3.8.1 which fixes the 'Advanced'
  button which was broken if you did not have JackD installed.
steamclient: updated to 1.0.0.45.
  Same conditions/requirements as mentioned in my 'Sun Feb 24 21:24:50 UTC 2013'
  ChangeLog.txt entry still apply.

item.title: Fri, 29 Nov 2013 09:32:01 GMT
item.description:
calibre: updated to 1.13.0.
  For the (unchanged) dependency list, see the 'Fri Aug 23 14:53:15 UTC 2013'
  entry in the ChangeLog.txt.

item.title: Sun, 24 Nov 2013 15:18:59 GMT
item.description:
chromium: I have added my Google API keys in the file 'chromium_apikeys'.
  This means you can rebuild the package yourself and get a fully functional
  Chromium browser. Note that you are explicitly _not_ allowed to re-distribute
  the file 'chromium_apikeys' containing my keys when you build a modified
  version of the package!
chromium-pdf-plugin: added version 31.0.1650.57. This is the PDF viewer for
  Chromium and Chrome based browsers, extracted from the official Chrome RPM.
  The version should match that of your Chromium package.
  By installing it, you agree to the license as included in the doc directory.

item.title: Fri, 22 Nov 2013 14:31:53 GMT
item.description:
chromium: added version 31.0.1650.57. Chromium is the open source variant of
  Google's Chrome browser.  Chrome and Chromium are based on the same code
  and releases are always parallel.
  My package contains the Native Client component which allows you to run
  applications in the browser at near-native speeds.
chromium-pepperflash-plugin: added version 11.9.900.152. This is a Flash plugin
  for the Chromium browser, extracted from the official Chrome RPM.
  This package needs my chromium package (install chromium first because the
  chromium file /etc/default/chromium must exist when you install the plugin!)
  By installing it, you agree to the license as included in the doc directory.
  Check http://www.adobe.com/software/flash/about/ afterwards.

item.title: Fri, 22 Nov 2013 11:46:14 GMT
item.description:
calibre: updated to 1.12.0.
  For the (unchanged) dependency list, see the 'Fri Aug 23 14:53:15 UTC 2013'
  entry in the ChangeLog.txt.
